result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa J Patten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution to be taken from up to 25% of prison wages. Said amount is joint and several with co-defendant in Forest County case 15CF102.
Concurrent with: Any sentence defendant is currently serving.
Costs to be taken from 25% of prison wages.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lisa J Patten in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Lisa J Patten in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:59 AM. State - resolved - plead G to only count, joint recommendation of 2 years in th WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES, concurrent to any and all sentences that she is currently serving, restitution of $20.00. Richards and Patten agree and also here for waiver of PH. Court has waiver, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State will be filing Information that mirrors the complaint. Richards will plead with the assumption that the Information mirrors the complaint. Patten pleads G. Court has plea questionnaire form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - has complied with victim notification requirements - restitution is joint and several - follow joint recommendation. Richards makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks to be made eligible for substance abuse programs. Patten makes statement, apologizes to Court. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 2 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement  - concurrent to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving - followed by 1 year of ES, conditions of ES are: restitution of $20.00 (Krist Oil) - to be taken from up to 25% of prison wages - joint and several with Houghton Hancock, costs - to be taken from 25% of prison wages, no additional conditions of ES, submit DNA sample - considers objection to that, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal, adjourned.

ADDRESS INFO for Lisa J Patten
Current: PO Box 1947 DOC #00637222, Taycheedah Correctional Institutuion, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 03-11-2016)
Prior: Marquette County Jail, Montello, WI 53949
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:12 AM. Richards reminds court that he has filed a speedy trial demand but defendant is in prison for approximately 8 years. Court will have State prepare a writ for INIT and instructs on preparing for a speedy trial demand.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 9, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Lisa J Patten not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:00 AM. State to find out where the defendant may be incarcerated at and do a writ. State prefers an arrest warrant. Court issues arrest warrant, body or $2000.00
